channel.title: Port not fully open
channel.description:
Canyousee me says the port is open and accepting connections. I can connect locally to the server fine if the client connects to 0.0.0.0. If I change the IP the client connects to to my actual IP, it will not work.
Even if I turn off my firewall and such it does not work. What am I doing wrong? SKype: thehomesmb for anyone who wants to add me for more direct replies

item.title: Port not fully open
item.dc:creator: @Redemtion Redemtion
item.description:
@Redemtion wrote:

My internet does the same thing, i can’t access my server using my external ip while internal and I’m not sure why, but just know that you can just set yourself a custom client with the ip to your computer on your local network, and have a public client linked to your no-ip or whatever you use and it should work fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Port not fully open
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Make sure you are forwarded to the right address in your router as well.

You really wouldn’t need much in terms of a VPS… Remote access could easily be replaced by FTP and remote process scheduling.

Read full topic

item.title: Port not fully open
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“ReaperXScape, post:7, topic:548552”]did u allow the port in your computer control panel?

Edit *Nvm down syndrome reply[/quote]
Yeah made sure and even turned off all firewalls to make sure. I’m probs just gonna buy a vps lmao haha

If anyone can recommend a good cheap windows one with remote access please message me!

Read full topic

item.title: Port not fully open

item.description:

did u allow the port in your computer control panel?

item.title: Port not fully open
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:548552”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=667465.msg4463713#msg4463713 date=1418939773]

If you’re on the same computer as the server, you shouldn’t need to connect using anything other than localhost…

Test it from a different computer to make sure that one connects…

The client should work on the computer I am hosting it on using localhost or the IP. And either way, if I use the client on a different computer it still does not work.
[/quote]
Check your router’s firewall.[/quote]
Turned router’s firewall off, did not fix it.

[quote=“sinisoul, post:5, topic:548552”]you cant use your own IP, you have to use localspace or alternative DNS

Use noip, or whatever[/quote]
I’ll try out no-ip

Read full topic

item.title: Port not fully open

item.description:

you cant use your own IP, you have to use localspace or alternative DNS

Use noip, or whatever

item.title: Port not fully open
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:3, topic:548552”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=667465.msg4463708#msg4463708 date=1418938983]
If you’re on the same computer as the server, you shouldn’t need to connect using anything other than localhost…

Test it from a different computer to make sure that one connects…
[/quote]

The client should work on the computer I am hosting it on using localhost or the IP. And either way, if I use the client on a different computer it still does not work.[/quote]
Check your router’s firewall.

Read full topic
